item.title: STATISTICS BUTTONS WHERE USERS CLICKE
item.description: Why? There is a demand when I at an interview. So I write this demo to note this tips. Get the button's infomation and current ViewController where the button has been clicked. How? In my idea 1. Redefine the button’s response event with runtime. 2. Create a class to get the current ViewController. 3. Add a function in to the button’s response event. So let’s start it! First we should add a category with UIButton named (UIButton+Counting), then import the runtime with (#import ), and redefine the (+ (void)load).
